column4: I keep running into a problem with wubi. Whenever I try to run it from a CD, it feels the need to redownload the iso.
I have limited bandwidth, so this simply isn't an option for me.
I strongly suggest you install traditionally (non-wubi)
I'm hesitant to install normally. This laptop has Optimus, and I want to see if I can get bumblebee to work properly before I do anything permanent.
I have no idea what Optimus and bumblebee is.  Try running the liveCD to see if they work?
I tried to do it, but ubuntu hangs at the loading screen.
Is this a liveCD or a liveUSB  Do you get any error messages when / before it hangs.
Press escape during boot to see more info
LiveUSB, and no.
Can you describe the hang?
Oh I was trying to switch VT's lol. Hold on.
That was a good thought too
hello
Rebooting my laptop now.
k
We can talk while we work on the target machine?
I have two laptops ;)
excellent
Now that's odd...
it's booting?
This time it didn't even show the bootsplash.
Gave me a couple errors though
mhmmm, I take it you didn't do anything differently.  What errors?
http://pastebin.com/UuNLRX0p
Oh and I forgot to mention that the fan starts running like crazy once it hangs.
You have intel graphics?
Yeah. Intel and Nvidia. That's what Optimus is. It switches video cards depending on load.
I have whatever's attached to the Core i7 and a Geforce 525m
Oh. Escape doesn't do anything.
Well escape makes the splash go away.  Do the num / caps lock keys make the lights change (proof themachine is not frozen)
That's a major problem. I don't have num/caps lock lights so I can't tell if it's panicking.
ok.  Hang on
Is the screen showing those errors and just stuck there?
It's showing the purple booting screen and doing a whole lot of nothing.
Is this a dell? mac?
Dell Vostro 3750
a-ha :)
a-ha what?
Found this: http://www.ubuntu.com/certification/hardware/201101-6969
still looking
It's certified even though it doesn't work. Good call there, Canonical.
hahaha
that should matter?
No, but you never know. There could be some proprietary drivers they had to install.

I have found this: https://lists.launchpad.net/hybrid-graphics-linux/msg00864.html   He has the same error as you on the same hardware however he is able to boot (cause he can run dmesg) which implies the errors we're seeing are not related to the can't boot problem
I've gotten it to boot before. That's the weirdest part.
What did you do to get it to boot?
Plugged in the usb stick, turned it on, and smacked F12 like a redheaded stepchild.
Why F12?
To get the one-time boot menu open.
for the bios.  You don't have to do that normally?
I was doing it so I could boot if from usb

sure, but you mentioned having to do that the time it worked.  This implies that you don't have to press F12 everytime.  (It's confusing me.  Is pressing F12 significant in the laptops ability to boot?)
Oh sorry. No, that's what I have to do to get it to boot from USB.
ok
It boots windows just fine.
one common thing.  Check the drives using windows
You mean the usb drive?
no, the partitions of the hdd
sometimes when the partitions are dirty or have errors ubuntu doesn't boot.  (or boot irradcially).  You could also (to save time) pop the hdd out for a second and boot with no hdd
Odd. The pre-boot assessment just popped up.
the bios post?
No. Dell's hardware test program that they install on a separate partition of the HDD.
mmm, strange
OK. Now that that's over, let's try booting again.
hahaha, what did it want from you?
It ran all the tests automatically. I think my laptop is possessed.
ha
Ok, I took out the splash boot option.
Let's see what it has to say.
ok, good idea
Huh. It came up with the same screen as before. There's an error there that I didn't notice before though.
[drm:intel_dsm_platform_mux_info] *ERROR* MUX INFO call failed
googling...
And of COURSE it's because I have sandy bridge. Of course.
That's what I think is the issue yes
Hold on, I have an idea.
holding
I'm gonna go grab an arch stick and see if that boots.
Damn. Looks like the most recent arch I have is 2010.05. Project for another day it looks like.
ok
Not sure why it's not booting.  I see other reports of that error and again they can boot anyways
I can try using an actual CD, though I doubt that'll help much.
agreed
Hmm. An idea is floating around in my head, but it seems dumb.
what is it?
I saw a way to install ubuntu directly from the iso using the USB creator.
good luck with that!
Like I said, dumb.
crazy and fun!
That's how I roll.
